name: Sofitel Cecil Alexandria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an older couple, we stayed at the Sofitel Cecil in April, 2009 in search of its historic origins. They gave us the 'Om Kalsoum' suite on the North-east corner - great views from both balconies. It's certainly quaint but charming. The buffet breakfasts and meals in the main dining room and the Asian roof-top restaurant were good.
reviews.title: Staff went the extra mile
very old
reviews.text: My wife needed to see a doctor late on our last night. At 11.45pm the duty manager organised an English-speaking female doctor, who arrived within 30 minutes with nurse and ambulance. The night assistant manager accompanied us to the hospital and organized everything, having us back at the hotel within an hour. During our whole stay we had cordial and personalised attention from all staff.

Looks very nice from the outside, and yes, it's a very historic hotel but... It's too old for Sofitel. Rooms definitely need refurbishment, so does the lobby area. Everything looks dusty and worn out. Although can't fault the service and food - deserves its 4*.
reviews.title: Heritage property

reviews.text: Needless to stay its a great heritage property well maintained over the years. It has that real old world charm. A place where legendary Agatha christie also stayed.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.text: Huge rooms with big bathroom. A flawless property.
reviews.title: Nice Historic Hotel

likes.disliked: — for rich tourists, a bit distanced from the culture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the plaza and the harbor. The room was large and old-fashioned, clean and comfortable. Churchill slept here. So did Noel Coward and Somerset Maugham. During WWII, this was the HQ of British Intelligence. If the hotel hasn't changed much since then (the bathrooms are modern), that's a considerable part of its charm. The breakfast buffet was good and included crepes and made-to-order omelets.
reviews.title: Very nice historic hotel

reviews.text: Beware the cranky wooden elevator. It's fun and works most of the time but on one trip from lobby to 3rd floor, it took me instead to the basement kitchen--and stayed there. (A short dash up the stairs got me back to the lobby.)
reviews.title: Faded Hotel, Needs an update badly

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights after visiting some family who lives in Cairo. After staying in other Sofitel properties I was expecting 4 star level amenities. The hotel is quite old, was previously known as the "Cecil" (all the locals still know it this way). I am by no means a super picky traveler, do not need a concierge to plan everything, never order room service etc. but this hotel is truly lacking in amenities. My room looked as it had been decorated in the 1960s and then left untouched (to be fair, the bathroom did appear newer). The noise of the AC unit was akin to a plane taking flight and my view was of someones wash and bathroom. I know other rooms had a better sea view as they were being repainted (with the doors wide open at all hours) and you could see straight through. It was at the end of a long smoke-filled hallway (thanks to the Monty Bar on the same floor) and the paint fumes were noticeable as well.
reviews.title: Cockroaches and rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say I was not too pleased with the hotel. Anyone who comes expecting Sofitel standards will be sorely dissapointed as well. With some extensive renovation, this hotel could be a gem. The location cannot be beat- right on the waterfront and near many of the attractions.
reviews.title: Great location and breakfast

reviews.text: We stayed here on two occasions. This hotel leaves a lot to be desired. The restaurant serves a great breakfast but dinner is so-so. Our first room opened onto an air shaft. Yuk. The second room had a peek-a-boo sea view if you went out on the balcony and turned your head, but the noise level was so intense from the street that we had to close the door right away. The room itself was nice, though small. The bath was nice. To try to cross the street to the ocean side for a walk is quite a challenge. You take your life in your hands but we did it with the help of some local girls the first time and returning was even more frightening as the traffic had increased and we just had to wait and wait and then run. First to the center divider and wait again until there was a moments opportunity. There are much better places to stay. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited the hotel for a look round perhaps for a later stay but what I saw was
reviews.title: for the historically interested

reviews.text: not good . The lobby waiter provided good service but his suit was full
reviews.title: The Monty Bar at the Sofitel Cecil Hotel Alexandria is friendly elegance

reviews.text: of old stains so I gave the cake a miss. Mont´ys bar was nice but expensiveI I got to see
reviews.title: Dont have high expectation

reviews.text: the back room next to the bar looked dirty with black mould on the walls . I am sure it
reviews.title: Don't go near the restaurant
Cecil best location..
reviews.text: Wonderful location.. was very glad that our first choice El Samalek was full - way too far out of town, overly smart & uninviting place (dinner jackets required etc). At Cecil, recommend upper floor , sea view room NB we had booked sea view room via their website for our 3 night stay but were initially shown a very small room overlooking the park.. however after much challenging we were given the Agatha Christie room on 5th floor with double aspect and harbour view to die for! Altho reception staff friendly, its definately worth challenging them to show you better rooms.

reviews.title: Faded
reviews.text: Hotel restaurant not great.. but short stagger recommended to Cab D'Or Bar (4 Adib Street) for wonderful 1920's atmosphere, tasty tapas like meals and great Alexandrian wine. Also Brazilian Coffee Store for best capuccinos is very close. And in nice weather, a stroll down the Corniche to the Fish Market is a must (in season book a table in advance tel 4805114)!

reviews.title: Very poor
reviews.text: Word of warning.. lock up yr valuables.. I lost my lovely gold signet ring there which I had hidden in my make up bag but only found out after we left Alex.

Existing in the past (Agatha Christie, Winston Churchill et al stayed here). Nothing bad to report but nothing to get excited about apart from a lift which said 'Do not use in case of Fire or Earthquake' . Room suite was very big but noisy. Amenties and breakfast OK. Roof terrace lacked any class. Would try somewhere else next time but not guaranteed to be better !
reviews.title: Not really suitable as a business hotel, but Cecil has plenty of charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrible: very poor service, antiquated rooms (windows that do not open, broken furniture, old beds, etc.), dated bathrooms. The breakfast buffet was adequate (with horrendous service) but the Chinese restaurant on the roof is a joke.
reviews.title: Atmospheric hotel with stunning views

likes.liked: — The cage lift and the rooftop views.

description: Sofitel Cecil Alexandria lets you experience all the splendor of this amazing city first hand. Conveniently located in the heart of the business district, overlooking the bay and yacht club, this exquisite hotel is just minutes from the airport, ideal for business or pleasure. Built in 1929 yet constantly in step with the times, it provides a perfect blend of modern amenities and old world charm. Discerning connoisseurs also appreciate the impeccable service and attention to detail.
